description: This course explores the notion of sacred places and examines specific sites sacred to
ancient people, Jews, Christians, and Muslims.  Students visit both natural landscapes and
places' physical characteristics and history, ongoing human interaction,
inter-religious dynamics, scholarly theory, and their own lived experiences of place.  The
life, and political power within sacred spaces provides additional thematic focus.
Offered periodically during January Term. Apply through Smith Center for Global Engagement.
Also counts toward ancient studies major.
fullname: Sacred Places in Greece and Turkey (study abroad)
